alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Greer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 4:34AM CDT until August 29 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL GREER AND EASTERN BECKHAM COUNTIES... At 434 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms continue in areas near and east of Sayre and north of Carter. Although rainfall rates have decreased, some areas may still receive another inch of rainfall. Storms have already produced 2 to 5 inches of rain this morning and flooding of creeks and flood-prone areas is likely this morning. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, towns, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sayre, Carter and Delhi. This includes the following streams and drainages... Haystack Creek, Short Creek, Coffee Bean Creek, Timber Creek, Flat Creek, Boggy Creek, Deep Creek, Long Creek, Sand Creek, Lake Creek, Spring Creek, and Sadler Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
